thread.title: International sales of sustainable technology are increasing
thread.title_full: International sales of sustainable technology are increasing

title: International sales of sustainable technology are increasing
text: Mechanical weeding is getting increasingly popular, also in light of the limitations that many European big retail chains are imposing on producers when it comes to chemical residue. That is why Calderoni, which specializes in equipment for orchards and vineyards, has introduced Unica Jolly, boasting a rotary machine suitable for orchards with plants at a distance of 60 cm. "Considering the current agronomic needs, it has become essential to weed the rows, especially in the summer when the lack of rain leads to weed growth. Our rotary machine enables an extreme precision around the trunks without damaging them. The automatic system makes it possible to operate between plants 60 cm apart as well." Unica Jolly with rotary machine. Unica Jolly is the Calderoni system that enables to join multiple equipment in just a few minutes, so that a single system can be achieved with multiple heads. Twelve accessories are available: rotary machine with blades, mini-mulcher, mini-cutter, Bio-rotor, rotary brush, furrow blade, rotary harrow, lawnmower disc, just to name a few. Alessandro Calderoni. Calderoni Rolando was set up in 1975 after the owner worked for years in his father's workshop in the countryside. It immediately stood out for its innovative solutions, especially for inter-row mechanical processing. "60% of our market is abroad, mostly in Northern Europe, North Africa and Eastern European countries."
